snippet.title: Raw Milk? A Fresh Glass Of Campylobacter And Salmonella. Yum.
snippet.description: A raw milk fad is sweeping the U.S., making many people deathly ill. Fans of raw milk are in denial about the benefits of pasteurization and seem stunningly ignorant of Louis Pasteur's achievement. Don't drink this stuff - and don't give it to your kids. read »

snippet.title: Salmonella Scare Hurts Smucker
snippet.description: Food maker posts Q3 earnings jump but expects peanut butter phobia to weaken profits in 2009. read »

snippet.title: Smucker Spooked By Salmonella
snippet.description: Consumer fears about peanuts will hurt 2009 profits, but the peanut butter and jelly maker posted a Q3 jump. read »

snippet.title: Peanut Pain For General Mills, Kroger
snippet.description: Food makers recall products made with peanut butter paste following salmonella outbreak. read »

snippet.title: General Mills, Kroger Recall Peanut Products
snippet.description: Salmonella outbreak leads some food makers to pull items made with peanut butter paste. read »

snippet.title: Peanut Problems For General Mills, Kellogg
snippet.description: Food makers are recalling peanut butter paste products amid a salmonella outbreak. read »

snippet.title: Eat That Tomato!
snippet.description: A salmonella outbreak across 17 states could mean big business for some tomato farmers. read »

snippet.title: ConAgra's Tasty Profits
snippet.description: The packaged food company is rescued by its trading desk for the second time after another salmonella scare strikes. read »

snippet.title: J.M. Smucker Shares Jammin'
snippet.description: Profit rose 19% due in part to a recall of peanut butter because of a salmonella scare. read »

snippet.title: Small, Free-Range Egg Producers Can't Escape Problems Of Factory Farms
snippet.description: Conscientious consumers often assume that eggs sourced from small farms are eggs that are immune to the problems facing factory farms. This is not always the case. Pastured hens raised on small farms commonly suffer from predation, disease, welfare abuse, and over-medication. The alternatives to factory farming may, in the end, turn out to require [...] read »
